comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message indicating that users have been added to a room. It appears in an info panel on the Home page and is likely displayed after users are successfully created in a room context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation 'ຜູ້ໃຊ້ເພີ່ມເຕີມ' literally translates to 'added users'. While not entirely wrong, it lacks the nuance of the English 'Users added.' It sounds slightly passive and less natural in Lao for this context. A more natural phrasing would emphasize the action of adding.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'ເພີ່ມຜູ້ໃຊ້' (Peem phuu sai) which translates to 'Added users' or 'Added a user' but is more conversational and accurate for the UI element's purpose. Alternatively, 'ຜູ້ໃຊ້ຖືກເພີ່ມ' (Phuu sai thuk peem) - 'Users were added' is a viable option but a bit more formal.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian translation "Utilizatorul a fost adăugat." translates to "The user was added." while the English "Users added." implies multiple users were added. The translation doesn't accurately reflect the plural form.

The translation 'පරිශීලකයින් එකතු කරන ලදි' is a literal translation of 'Users added' but doesn't convey the intended meaning naturally in Sinhala. It's a bit clunky. A more natural phrasing would indicate that users have been added to a room or group.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Possible alternatives include: 'පරිශීලකයින් එක් කරන ලදි' (Users were added), 'පරිශීලකයින් ඇතුළත් කරන ලදි' (Users included/integrated), or a more context-specific phrase depending on the specific functionality.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovak translation "Používatelia pridaní." is grammatically incorrect. The verb agrees with 'users' in plural, but the sentence structure is unusual. A more natural and grammatically correct phrasing is needed.
